title: Movietone News 045: Western Australia acclaims Opperman
other_title: Western Australia Acclaims Opperman: Brilliant Australian Cyclist of International Fame Lowers Record from Kalgoorlie to Perth by 27 Hours
subject_group: Hobbies, Recreation & Sport/Opperman, Hubert Ferdinand, Sir
abstract: Champion cyclist Hubert Opperman spends over 25 hours on his bike to break the cycling record from Kalgoorlie to Perth.
description: Sir Hubert Opperman, known to fans as 'Oppy' was a famous Australian cyclist who had been successful in Europe, winning the Paris-Brest-Paris in 1931 which was then the longest race in the world. 'Oppy' was a long distance specialist and in 1933 returned home to ride 377.8 miles (608km) in 25 hours and 37 minutes, breaking the previous record of 27 hours, 23 minutes. The record has since been broken but it was a remarkable achievement given the poor weather conditions he faced.  Courtesy Cinesound Movietone Productions.
